description: You can use the `SignatureInput` API to add signatures to forms made both with Wix Forms
and forms created manually using standard user input fields and a submit button.
Before working with this API, you must add a signature input element to your page. In the
Wix Editor, add a **Signature Field** and a **Submit** button to a form on your
page. The signature field comes with a signature pad and a built-in clear signature
button. After the site visitor draws their signature on the pad and submits the form,
the `SignatureInput` element's [`value`](#value) is populated with a base64-encoded
Data URL representing a PNG image of the signature.
With code, you can then:
+ Save the signature to a collection as an inline image in a field of type **Image**.
+ Upload the signature to the Media Manager, and then save the signature's URL to a collection.
+ Clear the signature from the signature pad with the [`clear()`](#clear) function.
+ Use the [`onChange()`](#onChange) event handler to detect if the signature value changed or was cleared.

docs.summary: Gets an object containing information about the signature input element's styles.
description: The following styles can be used with signature inputs:
+ [`backgroundColor`]($w.Style.html#backgroundColor)
+ [`borderColor`]($w.Style.html#borderColor)
+ [`borderWidth`]($w.Style.html#borderWidth)

notes:
Not all styles can be used on all signature designs. To determine which styles
 work with a specific signature design, go to the **Signature Design** panel in
 the Editor, choose a design, and click **Customize Design**. The design
 options that you see in the **Signature Design** panel are the styles you can
 use in your code.

docs.summary: Gets the value of the signature input.
description: The `value` is one of the following:
+ An image, defined as a base64-encoded Data URL representing a PNG image of a signature. For example: `data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAA...`
+ An empty string if the signature pad is blank.
To reset the signature input value, call the [`clear()`](#clear) function.

description: The [`value`](#value) of the signature input contains the signature that the site visitor has
signed. The `clear()` function erases the signature from the signature pad and clears the `value` property.
Clearing the signature triggers an [`onChange()`](#onChange) event handler, unless the signature input field is already empty.

docs.summary:
Adds an event handler that runs when a signature input element's value
 is changed by a site visitor.
description: A signature input element receives a `change` event when a site visitor changes its value.
A `change` event is not triggered when:
+ You, the site owner, change an element's value using the element's [`value`](#value) property.
+ The signature input field is empty, and the site visitor clears the signature.

members.name: value
members.doc: A signature, as a base64-encoded Data URL representing a PNG image. For example: `data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAA...`

notes:
**A Word About Inline Images**: 
 
 + Saving a signature as an inline image in a collection is supported because signatures are relatively small in size. We do not recommend that you store other types of images inline in collections for performance reasons.
 + You can preview inline images if using the new Content Manager. Because Wix Forms does not use the new Content Manager, do not store inline images in a collection generated by Wix Forms.
